intro: Pavetta sennii, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Pavetta sennii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
